{"bio":"Rashmika is highly qualified, conscientious and dedicated Legal Executive with over 30 years' experience in the legal field, the vast majority of which has been spent specialising in Family Law. Rashmika has a wealth of experience and knowledge in all aspects of family law, with a particular interest in financial proceedings involving complex high net worth cases to cases involving complicated child arrangements.

Fellow Member of Chartered Institute of Legal Executives (FCILEx) Rashmika has recently joined Osbourne Pinner as a Senior Legal Executive Consultant. Rashmika is highly qualified, conscientious and dedicated Legal Executive with over 25+ years' experience in the legal field, the vast majority of which has been spent specialising in Family Law. Rashmika has a wealth of experience and knowledge in all aspects of family law, with a particular interest in financial proceedings involving complex high net worth cases to cases involving complicated child arrangements. This experience and expertise allows her clients to feel confident that she has the awareness and understanding to advise them on all possible options and indeed, the best route to take on their particular issue.

Rashmika believes that each case is unique and will tailor service to her clients' needs, providing a holistic approach to alleviate stress and work with compassion and empathy to secure the most cost-effective outcome.

Rashmika deals with all aspects of relationship breakdown involving:

• Separation
• Divorce
• High Net Worth Financial Settlements
• Cohabitation Agreements
• Child Arrangements Orders
• Child Maintenance
• Injunctive relief","image":null,"skills":["Separation","Divorce","High Net Worth Financial Settlements","Cohabitation Agreements","Pre and Post Nuptial Agreements","Child Arrangements Orders","Child Maintenance","Injunctive relief"],"education":"Fellow Member of Chartered Institute of Legal Executives (FCILEx)","job_title":"Head of Family Law","pseudonym":"Rita","department":"Family Law","github_url":null,"description":"Rashmika is a highly qualified Legal Executive with over 30 years' experience specialising in Family Law, with particular expertise in high net worth financial proceedings and complex child arrangements.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/team-profile-rashmika-mehta/","display_order":3,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":["Fellow Member of Chartered Institute of Legal Executives (FCILEx)"],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":30,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":30}

{"bio":"Kirsty, a highly experienced family law solicitor, brings a wealth of expertise to her clients since 2004. Prior to her qualification as a solicitor, Kirsty's tenure as a fellow qualification with CILEX in family law honed her skills. Her comprehensive understanding encompasses all aspects of family matters, specialising in divorce, separation, matrimonial finances, and child-related disputes.

Notable achievements include successfully securing the return of a child abducted by their mother and representing clients in high net-worth financial matters to favourable outcomes. Kirsty's unwavering commitment and compassion set her apart. She believes that her pragmatic and considerate approach enables her to provide informed guidance to clients navigating this challenging terrain. Kirsty recognises the emotional complexities that intertwine with family law and strives to offer comprehensive support, encompassing legal, practical, and emotional aspects. Her dedication to ensuring the well-being of her clients shines through in her unwavering presence and empathetic understanding, guiding them toward a positive and dignified resolution.

Kirsty has extensive experience in all family matters and can assist with all aspects of divorce and separation. She has a wide understanding of matrimonial finances and disputes regarding children. Kirsty has dealt with several simple and complex high net worth financial remedy cases as well as has successfully represented clients with the complex children matter.

Kirsty is a committed and passionate solicitor, always there for her clients and believes her pragmatic and considered approach helps to advise clients on their best way forward. Kirsty fully understands that family law can be embroiled with difficult emotions but she will always try her best to support her clients throughout this difficult time providing legal, practical and emotional support.","image":null,"skills":["Divorce & separation","Matrimonial finances","Child-related disputes","High/ultra-high net worth divorces","Child abduction","Freezing orders","Trusts & dynastic wealth","International divorce jurisdiction","Non-disclosure of assets","Pre/post-nuptial agreements","Cohabitation disputes","Securing the right jurisdiction","Establishing needs","Inherited wealth and assets","Ensuring full disclosure of assets","High-value property sales","Unravelling complex financial and ownership structures","Suspected non-disclosure","Establishing matrimonial and non-matrimonial wealth","Protecting dynastic or other non-matrimonial wealth","Child custody and support arrangements","Further financial provision following a divorce in another jurisdiction"],"education":"Qualified solicitor since 2004; prior CILEX qualification in family law","job_title":"Senior Family Solicitor","pseudonym":null,"department":"Family Law","github_url":null,"description":"Kirsty is a highly experienced family law solicitor since 2004, specialising in divorce, separation, matrimonial finances, child-related disputes, and high/ultra-high net worth divorces.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":["Successfully secured the return of a child abducted by their mother","Represented clients in high net-worth financial matters to favourable outcomes"],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/team-profile-kirsty-louise-griffin/","display_order":4,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":[],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":21,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":21}

{"bio":"With over a decade of experience in family law, Claire Doroudi is dedicated to providing exceptional client care, building relationships founded on trust, and delivering outstanding results during challenging times. She navigates complex issues with a keen eye for detail, offering reassurance and going the extra mile for her clients.

Claire has extensive experience working with high net worth individuals, managing cases involving multiple properties and valuable assets, and knowing when to engage forensic accountants and other experts, such as actuaries for pension reports.

In matters concerning children, Claire has successfully handled difficult cases involving allegations of domestic abuse. She approaches these emotionally charged situations fairly and logically, ensuring clients are fully informed of the core issues. She also skillfully negotiates equitable settlements for cohabiting couples, providing clear expectations from the outset.

Furthermore, Claire possesses considerable expertise in obtaining non-molestation orders for clients needing court protection from domestic abuse. She is particularly passionate about assisting those who have experienced coercive control from current or former partners. Due to her client-focused approach, Claire quickly establishes strong rapport, leading to positive outcomes and high client satisfaction.","image":null,"skills":["High & Ultra-High Net Worth Divorce","Domestic abuse & coercive control","Non-molestation orders","Child arrangements","Forensic accounting & pension reports","International divorce jurisdiction","Trusts & dynastic wealth protection","Securing the right jurisdiction","Establishing needs","Inherited wealth and assets","Ensuring full disclosure of assets","High-value property sales","Unravelling complex financial and ownership structures","Suspected non-disclosure","Establishing matrimonial and non-matrimonial wealth","Protecting dynastic or other non-matrimonial wealth","Child custody and support arrangements","Further financial provision following a divorce in another jurisdiction","Separation","Divorce","High Net Worth Financial Settlements","Negotiation of consent orders","Cohabitation Agreements","Pre and Post Nuptial Agreements","Child Arrangements Orders","Injunctive relief"],"education":"","job_title":"Head of Family / Supervisor","pseudonym":null,"department":"Family Law","github_url":null,"description":"With over a decade of experience in family law, Claire specialises in high net worth divorces, domestic abuse, coercive control, and child arrangements with forensic accounting expertise.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/team-profile-claire-doroudy/","display_order":5,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":[],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":10,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":10}

{"bio":"Kiran has been a qualified Fellow of the Chartered Institute of Legal Executives for six years and has worked with people at all stages of relationship breakdown, helping them to reach agreements that work for them and their families. She has a particular interest in private children matters and financial remedy proceedings.\n\nKiran is known for her calm and empathetic approach, always putting the needs of her clients first. She is committed to resolving disputes in a non-confrontational manner wherever possible and has a strong track record in negotiation and mediation.","image":null,"skills":["Private children matters","Financial remedy proceedings","Negotiation","Mediation"],"education":"Fellow of the Chartered Institute of Legal Executives (FCILEx)","job_title":"Family Consultant (CILEX)","pseudonym":null,"department":"Family Law","github_url":null,"description":"Kiran is a qualified Fellow of CILEX with expertise in private children matters and financial remedy proceedings, known for her calm and empathetic approach.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":null,"display_order":6,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":["Fellow of the Chartered Institute of Legal Executives (FCILEx)"],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":6,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":6}

{"bio":"Kanchan has over 15 years of multidisciplinary legal experience and has worked on a variety of complex cases, she believes in a holistic approach by providing quality and clear legal advice. Kanchan has built long-term relationships with clients whose matters include both simple and very complex immigration cases. She has also experience in dealing with all aspects of Bail, Appeals and Judicial Reviews. Kanchan cares about getting the right outcome for her Immigration clients and she always works closely with each client to ensure that they achieve their desired objectives. Kanchan is able to offer legal advice in Punjabi, Hindi and Urdu in addition to English. As a woman specialising in Family and Business Immigration, Kanchan found that she had to react to a largely male dominated sector by gaining the respect of many of her peers. It was her aim to ensure that Osbourne Pinner represented the qualities that she would expect to receive as a client herself. The firm had to be innovative, forward thinking and relevant in order to be competitive and successful in the market and to meet Kanchan's own expectations of high quality client care. Kanchan's experience as a businessperson gives her a firm foundation and inside knowledge when advising business owners and Directors on the legal issues that affect businesses and she has significant experience in dealing with Sponsor Licences and skilled worker visas for various sectors including Chemical, Tech firms, Shipping, Retail and Accountancy. Her confident business instinct and tenacity, coupled with exceptional business development skills, has resulted in Kanchan generating clients from various sectors and organisations. She is immensely acquainted in advising new start up and well-established businesses on options for growth and development strategies. In 2020 Kanchan was awarded by Acquisition International the Most Trusted Family Law Firm – South East England which celebrates how far she developed the firm from the ground up. Kanchan was awarded in 2021 – SME News' Legal Awards, Sole Practitioner of the Year which celebrates her extraordinary talent as a lawyer and business person.","image":null,"skills":["Family and Business Immigration","Bail","Appeals","Judicial Reviews","Sponsor Licences","Skilled worker visas","Visa refusal cases","Detention/deportation work","Family visas","Asylum","Naturalisation and registration applications","Private life/long residence applications","Domestic abuse applications","Student and graduate applications","Domestic worker applications"],"education":"","job_title":"Practice Manager","pseudonym":null,"department":"Management & Immigration","github_url":null,"description":"Kanchan has over 15 years of multidisciplinary legal experience specialising in Family and Business Immigration, with expertise in Sponsor Licences, skilled worker visas, and complex visa refusal cases.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":["Most Trusted Family Law Firm – South East England (2020)","Sole Practitioner of the Year - SME News Legal Awards (2021)"],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/team-profile-kanchan-gooransingh/","display_order":7,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":[],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":15,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":15}

{"bio":"Anisa brings a wealth of experience from her extensive legal career, where she has represented prominent individual and business clients across numerous areas of immigration law. Her current specialisation covers a diverse range of immigration matters.

Highly regarded in her field, Anisa is known for her substantial experience and comprehensive understanding of the Immigration Rules and court processes across all tracks. Having represented both claimants and defendants, she offers a nuanced perspective on immigration law.

Anisa is a highly experienced legal professional specializing in visa-related matters, particularly in navigating the complexities of visa refusals, appeals, and judicial reviews. Her track record speaks for itself, boasting a remarkably high success rate in these challenging areas. Anisa's expertise extends to representing clients at both the First Tier Tribunal and Upper Tribunal, where she has successfully overturned numerous refusals. Beyond appeals, she also has a proven record of accomplishment in securing successful entry clearance and dependent visa applications, even offering a guarantee of success in certain cases. What truly sets Anisa apart is her commitment to working closely with her clients, ensuring they receive personalised attention and strategic guidance to achieve the best possible outcome for their immigration goals.

Beyond her technical expertise, Anisa is a forward-thinking professional with exceptional analytical, communication, and organisational skills, complemented by a keen attention to detail. She excels at providing strategic and commercial legal advice on a variety of legal challenges, communicating effectively, flexibly, and with a sympathetic understanding of her clients' needs. She is well-positioned to work closely with both our private and corporate clients.","image":"https://osbournepinner.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Anisa-Ejaz-1.jpg","skills":["Business and Individual Immigration","Judicial Reviews","Sponsorship Licence","Skilled Worker Visa applications","Point Based System – Tiers 1, 2, 4, and 5","Innovator Visa","Start Up Visa","Global Talent Visa","High-net worth Investors Visa","Intra Company Transfers","Students Visas","Visitors/Tourist Visas","Unmarried partners visa","Spouse visa Applications","EEA Application and extensions","Settlement and Naturalisations","Entry Clearance Applications and Appeals for Refusals","Long Residency applications","Human Rights application and Judicial Reviews","Bail Applications for Detentions and Deportations","Appeal and Upper Tribunal Appeals"],"education":"","job_title":"Senior Immigration Solicitor (Business and Personal Immigration Specialist)","pseudonym":null,"department":"Immigration","github_url":null,"description":"Anisa is a highly experienced immigration solicitor specialising in visa-related matters, particularly visa refusals, appeals, and judicial reviews with a remarkably high success rate.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/anisa-ejaz/","display_order":11,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":[],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":null,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":null}

{"bio":"Samina Akuji is a passionate immigration solicitor with over 10 years of experience within all areas of UK and EEA inbound immigration, with a particular focus on PBS Tier 1 business and Tier 2 corporate matters.\n\nSamina has assisted a variety of organisations with their visa, sponsor licence and compliance needs throughout my career, including a nationwide company with over two thousand migrant employees.
